title: Seeds or Seedlings? How to Grow a Vegetable Garden Without a Ton of Effort
sub_head: Even the horticulture pros tell our time-strapped columnist there’s no shame in skipping the risky germination stage and starting off with nursery-bought plants
body:
MOST EDIBLE GARDENS are too much work. I learned this the hard way, when we lived on Long Island and shared a community garden with six friends.
The plot was the last one available and undesirable: swampy, weed-filled, rocky and sloped. But we had big dreams. “Watermelons,” suggested Ford, who grew up in Texas. “Okra,” said Jean, who grew up in South Carolina. “Papayas,” said my husband, who is from Mars.
